Metadata: Lophotoxin irreversibly inactivates the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor by preferential association at one of the two primary agonist sites

Lophotoxin has been isolated and purified from various species of coral of the genus "Lophogorgia". Its diterpenoid structure makes it unique among neuromuscular blocking agents since it does not carry a positive charge. Studies in isolated neuromuscular preparations have revealed a postsynaptic site of action that is not reversed with prolonged washing. In this study we have examined lophotoxin antagonism of the nicotinic receptors in BC3H-1 cells in order to (1) delineate further its site of action and (2) ascertain its utility in studying the coupling between ligand occupation and response.
